website_summaries.verdict: Fun, cone-shaped molds in bright colors with matching lids. No sticks needed, just push up to enjoy.
pros: Round bottoms make cleaning easy, molds stay upright like little soldiers in freezer
Also use for snack storage and/or frozen drinks
cons: Some feel the molds are not reusable
Silicone has odd texture, may need to warm hands to release treat

customer_reviews.title: Don’t pass the pinch test
customer_reviews.text: Was so excited to get these. They look great and are larger than I expected, but sadly these do not pass the silicone pinch test. 😞
customer_reviews.author: A. P.

customer_reviews.title: These are fun!
customer_reviews.text: These are fun! I put all kinds of juices in them to freeze. Don't fill it all the way to the top! Leave maybe an inch of room for expansion. Here's a hint: if you have the kind of freezer shelves with slots or thin metal wires, do NOT let the Ice Pop Molds slip between them before they freeze. Because when they do freeze around the shelving, you will not be able to remove them! Maybe put them upright in a plastic box or plastic juice cup until they freeze.
customer_reviews.author: Cat Mann

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, fun for kids, multi purpose
customer_reviews.text: These are great! My toddlers love popsicles so I've been filling these with juice or smooth yogurt and giving one to them on warm afternoons. Fairly easy to use for my 3 yr old though my 19 mo old still needs my help or else it gets turned upside down and spills. They both love playing with them once they've been emptied too. :P I saw mention of them being used to store dry goods like nuts or dried fruit which seems like a great idea, tho I've not tried it yet. The lid stays on well and they're a great size. Definitely a good product with a variety of uses!
customer_reviews.author: CastnetCommerce

customer_reviews.title: Loved it so much we bought more
customer_reviews.text: Loved it so much we bought more. Excellent for alcohol freezies. Adulting like a pro. Also, if anyone finds a way to use these to recreate actual freezies to avoid massive plastic waste, please share. We tried soda and koolaid with fizzy water already but they freeze too solid. Also, I recommend using your surplus of hoarded coffee mugs to prop these upright in the freezer. Impress the college you graduated from by using their memorabilia to enable your budding alcoholism. They'll love it.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product
customer_reviews.text: Love these so much I ordered a second set this time as a gift. We freeze smoothies in these and kids think they are having a treat- they are happy and I am too- we have a dozen for pops for the week! These are a thicker silicone then other brands we have tried, worth the extra few dollars. Easy to clean and have held up to weekly use and abuse for a year. This is our second time ordering (kids bite on the ends and twist to get the pop out- some pieces broke after a few years). Make sure to put warm water in these and use a bottle brush because stuff sticks in the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: kim connector

customer_reviews.title: They are super awesome. They work well too
customer_reviews.text: They are super awesome. They work well too. The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is because after washing them and letting them air dry and putting in some Kool aid juice in it there was a very odd smell and you can kind of taste it on the pops.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome!! Easy to use and clean
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome!! Easy to use and clean.... plus the colors are really fun! I used fruit punch rehydrate to make the popsicles and they taste so good. I did put them in a bowl to freeze just as extra precaution to not leak in the freezer before they were frozen. These are great quality and I would even gift them in the future!
customer_reviews.author: kelley

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations!
customer_reviews.text: Great size. Durable. The lid stays on tight, so you can easily freeze them standing upright on the lid. They’re easy to clean too! Just FYI, if you’re going to freeze them standing on the lid, don’t use any carbonated beverage for your pop. It will pop open, from the pressure. We bought two sets of these, so our family has popsicles available regularly. Definitely worth the buy.
customer_reviews.author: Helen Redman

customer_reviews.title: These are a great size for popsicles
customer_reviews.text: These are a great size for popsicles, not too big and not too small. Unlike other reviewers, I haven't had any issues with the liquid popsicle leaking out in the freezer before it freezes. The lids fit on snugly, but they're not too difficult to put on. I've made a bunch of batches of popsicles with these since I bought them, and have frozen them laying flat in my freezer with no issues. I liked them so much, I bought a second set!
customer_reviews.author: watercat

customer_reviews.title: Mine pinch white so unsure if these have fillers or not.
customer_reviews.text: Just got mine and they certainly pinch white. From what I have read that is not what you are looking for in food safe silicone.
customer_reviews.author: Lizard in the Air

customer_reviews.title: LOVE these! I use them to fill with yogurt ...
customer_reviews.text: LOVE these! I use them to fill with yogurt in my boys lunches. I freeze them in advance and they help keep everything cool too! Just leave an inch or so when filling so you don't overfill them. Make sure you get all the air out and they form a good seal. We've never had them open in his lunch box. These were well worth the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Nifty Ice Pop Makers---The kids (and Adults) will love them!
customer_reviews.text: Ice pops---who doesn't love them? I bought my granddaughter a set so my daughter could make her favorite snack. And my son-in-law really likes them too.I like that you can create all sorts of recipes (frozen diluted juice with some mashed up fruit even works well). I even made low carb treats for the diabetic in my household----(coconut milk, chocolate powder, stevia etc.) . Whatever your recipe I am sure you will be delighted with these 4 oz. easy to clean, silicone tubes. Gets a little messy at the end, but isn't that what all popsicles are like? Great gift, great price!
customer_reviews.author: Allison K

customer_reviews.title: We love these! I ordered them to fill with smoothies ...
customer_reviews.text: We love these! I ordered them to fill with smoothies or yogurt for our 16 month old toddler son. We take them out of the freezer and run under warm water for a few seconds to thaw a little bit. They are very high quality and they keep him occupied for a long time. As a bonus, they are great to fill with smoothies while toddlrs are teething- perhaps the best teething product I have found.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BEST BY A COUNTRY MILE
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these and another brand. These out rank the others by a country mile. Quality is apparent from the appearance and the touch. The performance is great. The others leaked, making a mess. Those with an attached lid (stopper) seemed a good choice, but the attachment proved a weakness; the leaks consigned those to the discard pile. These never failed. These have held the contents in every position. Fruit juice, yogurt, smoothies,--all serve neatly and completely. They were purchased for post-operative treats and filled the need in an excellent fashion.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Great for teething toddler
customer_reviews.text: Great for teething toddler. It's portable and I can put the lid back on and stick it back in the freezer for my son to finish later. Much harder to do with a normal Popsicle mold! I made homemade strained milk kefir, added mashed strawberries and a little honey. Much healthier than what you can buy in the store and less food waste.
customer_reviews.author: Chrispi

customer_reviews.title: Great invention
customer_reviews.text: These are great and I love them. No mess 'cause you can put them in the freezer upside down, or lying flat and they don't leak. This means I can shove them in any little crevice in my overly stuffed freezer. Also they freeze really fast. I use them to make smoothie pops, tea or lemonade pops that I put into my ice tea, and flavored pops for my husband.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: I've wanted something like this forever
customer_reviews.text: I've wanted something like this forever! I wanted otter-pop-style instead of on-a-stick style. I didn't know it existed until it popped up when I was looking for other popsicle molds. I've only used each of them once but so far they are great. They hold the perfect amount for me and the tops seal well. I'd make sure to rinse them immediately after use though because it might be hard to clean if you don't. You could always just pop the lid back on with some water to soak though. You can't turn them inside out like I thought I might be able to.
customer_reviews.author: Meagan

customer_reviews.title: Far from frivolous!
customer_reviews.text: I've had my eye on these guys for almost a year before I could justify what I thought was a frivolous purchase. I'm committed to preparing healthy meals and snacks for my child so of course these ice pops make perfect sense! I just blend up fruit with juice and two hours in the freezer is the perfect not frozen but mushy consistency for little ones. The lids are perfect to reuse the uneaten pops later. Each pop holds a little less than 1/2c but not as little as 1/3c of liquid. It's not precise because you have to leave room, about an inch at the top for the lid to fit in.
customer_reviews.author: V. Sofitel

customer_reviews.title: These are great, but I have to use a spoon to ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great, but I have to use a spoon to eat from it b/c I'm not a fan of the taste the silicone gives off. Easy to use and love that they are dishwasher safe. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Great popsicle molds!
customer_reviews.text: I am pregnant and have been suffering with awful nausea. At the suggestion of a family member, my husband ordered these so we could make ginger ale and lemon-lime popsicles to ease my nausea. These are wonderful. They make great popsicles that are easy to eat. They are very simple to clean, too! You just pop them in the dishwasher. The only complaint I have is that the silicone maintains a bit of a strange odor, although that may just be my pregnancy nose. I certainly recommend these anyway, as it isn't incredibly bothersome, just odd.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca F

customer_reviews.title: Best Pop Tubes we've owned
customer_reviews.text: Kids take these to preschool for froze smoothie pops in the morning. I like that the bottom portion of the tube is rounded, which makes for easier cleaning than those that are more square. Cleaning is easy...rinse out then stick in the top rack of the dishwasher. The only drawback is that the lids aren't attached. We haven't lost any yet, but there may be a time...
customer_reviews.author: M+H L

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: One of the molds smelled funky (like paint) after freezing it with ice cream inside. May just be a fluke as the others are just fine. Overall, VERY pleased with this product! I will be ordering again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for little kids!
customer_reviews.text: These are a great product. I make make smoothies to try to sneak some veggies into my 4 year old's diet and it's super easy to pour the smoothie right from the blender into these molds. The covers pop on easily and I've never had any issues with leaking (and I truly just throw them into the freezer). Best of all they are incredibly easy to clean. The empty mold sits in my daughters lunch box all afternoon and although the remains of the smoothie start to dry, it all comes right out when I start to clean it - no issues with stuck on food.
customer_reviews.author: AlyMac

customer_reviews.title: Not just for kids!
customer_reviews.text: We make alternative ice creams (eggless, dairy free, ketogenic) and they freeze much harder than custard based ice creams. If we put our alternative ice creams in a single large container we have to wait 15-20 minutes for it to soften enough to serve. Then after serving we have to refreeze the entire tub. These ice pop makers are a great way to easily create single serves. We just run them under warm water and they're ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: Always Reading

customer_reviews.title: I bought these for soda, but...
customer_reviews.text: The day I tried Mtn. Dew Voltage, the taste was reminiscent of popsicles, so I thought it would be nice to make Mtn. Dew Voltage popsicles. This was the result: most of the flavor settled at the top, so when I got near the bottom, there was a lack of the taste from the soda. I never really used them again, since the only reason I bought them in the first place was to use Mtn. Dew Voltage with it.
customer_reviews.author: voorhees

customer_reviews.title: Kids love!
customer_reviews.text: I like the bright colors of the popsicle molds. They are easy to use and clean. Kids love them! 4 out of 5 stars due to the fact that I had to put them in a seperate container to stand them up in the freezer to prevent leaking.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Green

customer_reviews.title: Work great. Lots of fun with the kids
customer_reviews.text: The kids and I had fun filling this up with orange juice, and then having an orange icy the next morning. I was mostly impressed with how easily the frozen liquid came out.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Provan

customer_reviews.title: Works well, good design
customer_reviews.text: The cap goes on fairly easy and holds well. Have not tested its hold against leaks by tilting before freezing. Easy to use and easy to clean in the dishwasher. Wish they came with a stand but haven't had any problem propping them up in the freezer wire shelving. Only negative is that they had a slight smell initially which has gone away after a few washings.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: FINALLY, a freezer pop contraption that works!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried so many different ice pop molds over the years, but they never work quite right. These are AWESOME!!!! I can make my own healthy concoctions (generally Greek yogurt, frozen berries, vanilla & stevia) and enjoy a guilt-free snack. They wash up easily (just stick them in a bowl of soapy water for a few seconds and wipe down). Just be aware: don't overfill (leave about an inch at the top to allow for expansion and the cap), and I prefer to "prop" them in my freezer. FYI - you can also add vegetable glycerin to your mix to prevent it from freezing to a rock-hard consistency (or a high proof liquor like vodka if you're so inclined)
customer_reviews.author: Reader, Mom and wanna-be decorator

customer_reviews.title: Heavenly Ice Pop Molds
customer_reviews.text: I am addicted to using my ice pop molds and have already made several flavored pops, The Honeydew Lime Pops are my favorite. Wow, are they delicious! Love the bright colors of the molds and that they are BPA-free. I washed them in the dishwasher and they cleaned like a charm. By the way: the company that manufactures the molds is excellent--they emailed me the recipe of the delicious Honeydew Lime Pops, plus other really wonderful recipes. Highly recommended--I am buying more for my friend so he can make pops with his daughter. They love making yummy dessert projects together, and the molds are so easy to use that his 5-year old can handle it.
customer_reviews.author: Scarlett Red

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful addition to my kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to make healthy snacks for my family and especially for my baby who LOVES popsicles. I've been trying different recipes but the one that seems the best is fresh pineapple, orange juice, grape juice and pineapple blended together to make a smoothie. I add more liquid than solids. Great product with cute packaging! I plan on buying more as gifts.
customer_reviews.author: MissNDMelo

customer_reviews.title: We make tons of smoothies and love to turn them into popsicles
customer_reviews.text: We make tons of smoothies and love to turn them into popsicles. Our plastic pop makers kept breaking or we were losing the sticks. I love these so much. I even send them to school in my kids lunch! The lids pop on and of easy. I was concerned about laying them flat in my freezer but I have not had one leak! Also, no leaks in my kids lunch! It is a healthy way to snack and they were the price of two popsicle boxes so in my mind a great deal. They are easy to wash and I just throw them in the dishwasher no problem! great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Britney

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Simple
customer_reviews.text: These are perfection! I wanted something that could lay on its side so these were a better option than the traditional molds with sticks. They are so easy and simple to use, just leave an inch of room at the top before freezing and you’re set. We rinsed the sides for about 30 seconds before eating and they slid right on out of the molds. Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie L.

customer_reviews.title: Does not feel like silicone
customer_reviews.text: These are not made of silicone. The material feels more like rubber or some other cheaper plastic that will leach into the popsicle. Note the weird powder stuff coating the molds in the photo.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Finally, I have an easy-to-use product to make popsicles that my son can eat. We have so many food restrictions that it's hard to buy premade items at the store. This gives me the freedom to make something he likes that won't make him sick.
customer_reviews.author: CJ Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great idea. Love yogurt and frozen fruit buzzed in ...
customer_reviews.text: Great idea. Love yogurt and frozen fruit buzzed in the blender in these for my son. BUT you need to let them warm up a bit before you can actually push the popsicle out. And, because they are rubber, its a bit hard for my 3 yr old to keep the rubber pushed together as they eat. And, they pick up freezer odors so I keep mine in a gallon plastic bag in the freezer.
customer_reviews.author: K.W.

customer_reviews.title: I bought these so I could send a frozen treat ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these so I could send a frozen treat in my daughter's breakfast and/or lunch. Unfortunately it had leaked in her lunch bag by breakfast! I'm guessing the pressure from being in the bag just popped the top right off. It was frozen solid when I packed it, and I figured it would thaw a little bit, but not that much. I pack her lunch around 6:40am and her breakfast is at 7:30, so I was very surprised that it had melted as much as it did. I'm open to suggestions, I followed the directions exactly, so I'm not sure where I went wrong. We'll still use these, but just not in the lunch bag.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel F.

customer_reviews.title: These work really well
customer_reviews.text: Our family really likes these molds! The lids go on firmly enough that they won't just pop off without a little effort. Sometimes they leak a little if they're laying on their sides and the contents are not frozen. In all, though, I don't find it hard to prop them up in the freezer while they freeze, and we love being able to make healthy frozen desserts! Also, it say's "100% Silicone" on the bottom, and the tubes don't turn white when doing the "pinch test," so I am hopeful that they don't have dangerous fillers in them. We will buy this high quality set again.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Easy to make healthy treats in these
customer_reviews.text: These are great. I make vegan protein smoothies and freeze it in these pop makers for a treat during the day. Easy to use. Easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Starryteller Books

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful treat...buy several sets!
customer_reviews.text: A fantastic product. Living in Florida we keep frozen treats in the freezer year-round and the cost associated can be pretty substantial but we've found that these molds keep the freezer full at a fraction of the cost. The flavors are only limited by your imagination and you can control the ingredients. The molds are super easy to clean and seem to be indestructible. I'm impressed by the quality and ease of use. Buy several sets so you can keep the freezer full.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Bean

customer_reviews.title: Not just for the kids !!  Great purchase..
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent molds for anything you like to eat frozen, I received them just before going on a beach vacation so I took them with me..I froze orange juice, lemonade, yogurt and stawberries, they were delicious on the beach !! They dont take up much room in your freezer, i have frozen them laying on their side and upright, just dont overfill..I find that filling them half to three quarters full is plenty enough for a toddler to enjoy..They can also be used like jello shots for the adults !!
customer_reviews.author: Joanie K

customer_reviews.title: These are so amazing. Just what I’ve been needing to replace freezing ...
customer_reviews.text: These are so amazing. Just what I’ve been needing to replace freezing expensive yogurt tubes from the store. I made a batch of smoothies and froze them. My kiddos loved them. They are so easy to clean up and feel really sturdy. I should’ve bought more!
customer_reviews.author: Kellianne Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Great -- don't link, easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: These work great! Most importantly, they don't leak. So you can lay them flat in your freezer after you fill them, though I like to stand them up so the liquid freezer where I want it to. These are easy to eat and east to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Picky in DC

customer_reviews.title: These are so wonderful! I wish they came in a twelve pack
customer_reviews.text: These are so wonderful! I wish they came in a twelve pack. Very easy to clean - I use a tiny drop of soap, add a little water and holding it upright, roll it between my hands. My kids love these, and they have already saved me a lot of money because I'd pay $5 for the all fruit type of popsicles every week. Thank you Food Works!!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Pruszynski

customer_reviews.title: for popsicles
customer_reviews.text: My son likes to use these to put in fruit juice and freeze them to make popsicles. It is easy to remove and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Buy these, not the cheap knock-offs
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with these and thankful to the reviewer who pointed out how these are superior to the cheap knock-offs (photos were very helpful). Good quality, would recommend buying this brand. I wish they were made in the USA though. PS: I use a bottle brush to get them clean.
customer_reviews.author: C.A.

customer_reviews.title: We love these! We purchased them so that we could ...
customer_reviews.text: We love these! We purchased them so that we could send healthy frozen treats in our children's school lunches, and they have been a great success. After a few weeks, we're using them often and loving them. The caps may not be fully water tight, but they are close. Since they don't come with a stand, we've just been standing them up in a cup in the freezer. This has worked well. We also love the recipes the company sent and the fact they checked in with us to make sure we received the product and were satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Natural Water makes AWESOME Ice Pops
customer_reviews.text: My grand-daughter LOVES these. I fill them with all kinds of natural juices I blend. Plain Watermelon juice...Coconut water with a pinch of agave syrup and cinnamon...Orange and Carrot juices; The Coconut is one of her favorites but she loves them all. She is only 2.4 years old and has already figured out how to 'squeeze' them to push them up. And, since they are completely contained, they don't make a mess. If it's too much for her, I simply re-seal them and put them back in the freezer for later. They don't leak, they are easy to clean and most importantly, snack time is healthy!!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Alicea

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Not only are these exactly as described, but I felt like such a valued customer. I recieved an email shortly after I ordered giving me helpful tips on how is best to use them. And once they were delivered I recieved another email asking how I liked the product and if I had and concerns or questions on them. The molds are great! I see that some clear ones are "coming soon" and bc my entire kitchen is one color, I Wish I had waited for the solid or clear ones vs. The rainbow. However, the product is great! Easy to wash, and seals well! I would and have already recommended this product! LOVE IT
customer_reviews.author: KRIS10

customer_reviews.title: Weird taste
customer_reviews.text: I've tried several liquids in these molds and they come out with a weird taste every time. Even my toddler doesn't like them and she LOVES my homemade popsicles. :(
customer_reviews.author: Ari-Ann

customer_reviews.title: ... smoothies in place of popsicles and the result is amazing. They slide out easily
customer_reviews.text: We use these to freeze excess smoothies in place of popsicles and the result is amazing. They slide out easily. Cleaning can be a bit difficult if you leave them sit out, but if you rinse them immediately it’s a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size and material
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size and material. Especially like the lids on so they can be placed around in the freezer up or down or sideways, whatever the need. highly reccomend!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Fills easily and no leak tops
customer_reviews.text: These guys are awesome! I made a bunch of smoothie pops to freeze, and these made the filling of them a breeze-no need for a funnel. The lid stays on great and zero leaking. I only wish that you could buy replacement tops, because my daughter lost one in a matter of minutes when she took it outside. Over all great purchase other than not being able to get extra lids, which is the only reason I gave the 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: JennieP

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, do not turn upside down.
customer_reviews.text: They work fine, but DO NOT turn them upside down!!! Half of my lids fit ok, the other half were loose (and I ordered 2 sets so it wasn't just a bad box). You can actually see notches in some of the silicone around the rim where they were Probably damaged during unmolding. Difficult to find places to lodge them in for freezing. Upside is they do freeze fast - I was able to freeze some OJ for my son in 4-5 hrs. Also, there is no fill line & since you can't turn them upside down there's a gap at the top instead of looking full.
customer_reviews.author: Erin McCoy

customer_reviews.title: Bold Colors and No Leak Construction
customer_reviews.text: Molds are well-made and the colors are very vibrant. Lids secure very well and we haven't had any leakage. We use these every single week and they have lasted and kept their integrity. Previous popsicle molds from Ikea were flimsy and they got holes in them too easily. These work very well. Would like to have a stand to use in the freezer just to keep them tidy.
customer_reviews.author: RLC

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome. I've never had them leak while freezing but ...
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome. I've never had them leak while freezing but the tops have popped up when I've over filled them, but that's my fault. I thought the lid would be hard to get on after filling but they push right on. I'm not sure if you can freeze them laying down, without leakage, but they freeze really well upright in a glass or large measuring cup.
customer_reviews.author: skatelate

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome!!! They are dishwasher safe, BPA free, and they don't leak! We have so far made ice pops and juice pops! The company even sent me an email with some frozen yogurt recipes! I will be purchasing these again as Christmas gifts for family members!
customer_reviews.author: Mom3

customer_reviews.title: These are great!. Only problem is cleaning milk/yogurt based Popsicle ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great!. Only problem is cleaning milk/yogurt based Popsicle concoctions from the molds. You will need a dollar store baby bottle brush to clean deep down inside. Great for fruit juices or sodas. Popsicle need some type of sugar to create tiny ice crystals. No sugar free drinks; otherwise it's a big stick of solid of ice.
customer_reviews.author: M. Parrish

customer_reviews.title: Fast delivery!  Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Love these! I like them better than the Zoku that I spent $50 on (another story for another day). These are easy to fill with your own fresh, clean ingredients! My first batch I used peach yogurt, plain yogurt, SF peach torani syrup, a splash of almond flavoring and a can of peaches (drained and rinsed) all blended up in my blender. Yummy to say the least.Can't wait until fresh fruit is in season here to do strawberry, blueberry...the sky is the limit!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Nicholls

customer_reviews.title: Fun for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use. Fun colors. My toddler has a hard time figuring out how to push the popsicle up and put and keep it that way. They love the silicon though and chomp on it frequently. I wish it came with 8 cause every recipe I use is for 8 molds and I have leftovers purees lot.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Great product great company!
customer_reviews.text: These ice pop makers were recommended to me by a friend. Having tried several other styles, I needed something silicone-based, but not too big. These are perfect!!! They even come with a lid that fits securely. Also the company is fantastic to deal with! They've e-mailed me a few times to follow-up on my purchase, send me recipes and make certain I'm happy with this product. I most definitely am!! I'd highly recommend these ice pop makers!
customer_reviews.author: MDS Houston

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: These are cute, easy to use, and the seller sends emails with recipes after purchase. I bought them to make our own tube yogurt for on the go but we've actually been using them a lot this summer for freezing juice or smoothies for popsicles. I love that you can fill them up, pop the lids on, and toss them in the freezer and not worry about them spilling.
customer_reviews.author: Summer Goddard

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: These are doing a great job at reducing the mess from drips, but they are really hard to get started! I have to run them under hot water and really bend/crunch the pop inside to get it unstuck so that my kids can eat them!! They're also hard to clean and stand up in the freezer.
customer_reviews.author: Old fashioned Planner

customer_reviews.title: Your grandkids might like these
customer_reviews.text: I thought these would be the thing for grandkids but they don't like homemade popsicles. They like the store ones. This is purely a like-don't like on their part. If your grandkids are more forgiving or like tailor made popsicles, this will be the thing.
customer_reviews.author: Dippy Diner

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!
customer_reviews.text: Found these to replace my other standard popsicle molds. Silicone ones are a lot better. Thanks to the reviewer who recommended these over the ones that are more flat on the bottom. Easy to clean. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: JAS

customer_reviews.title: Love these! They are the perfect size for our ...
customer_reviews.text: Love these! They are the perfect size for our 2 year old. This is the second set we purchased because it's easier to fill our Vitamix to the top and make a big batch of green smoothie to fill them! They are super easy to clean too. Just toss them in the dish washer.
customer_reviews.author: J. Melia

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My Grandkids love these popsicles. The rubber molds makes it easy for those little hands to stay unfrozen!
customer_reviews.author: Glenda C.

customer_reviews.title: Love these pop molds
customer_reviews.text: Pop tube work great, they don't leak and are supper easy to clean. I wanted a way to save whatever fruit I had before it went bad I just blend what ever fruit I had plus a Greek yogart in a blender an then poor into these molds a great way to have breakfast on the go or for a healthy snack. Tubes clean supper easy and are really kid friendly. They take up very little space in the freezer.
customer_reviews.author: K. Borg

customer_reviews.title: Fun & Easy!
customer_reviews.text: Fun and easy. They seal well and don't leak if the fall over in the freezer before they are frozen. Love the bright colors! I just pour in juice and freeze--haven't tried any of the actual recipes yet, but they all sound good, too.
customer_reviews.author: LW

customer_reviews.title: Useful for making ice pops out of your favorite juices
customer_reviews.text: These silicone ice pop maker molds are useful for making ice pops out of your favorite juices. I wanted to find frozen desserts made with organic juices and no added sugar. I can make exactly what I want with these. I found it difficult to freeze them because they don't stand on their own, but I solved this by putting a tapered vase in my freezer that I could stand the juice pops in until they got hard.
customer_reviews.author: F. Orion Pozo

customer_reviews.title: Yay popsicles!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had any problems with these so far. I fill it to about an inch away from the top, put the lid on, and lay it flat in the freezer overnight. In the morning I have a healthy fruit pop! It is a bit tricky getting the lid on but I found the easiest way for me is to perch the lid on top and then pinch it closed all the way around (almost the same finger motion you use to close a Ziploc bag).
customer_reviews.author: EJ

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: Almost got the popsicle molds and then I saw these. They give way less mess and they're multi-use! So far we've put water in them for water bottle ice, leftover smoothie for a push-popsicle, and cheerios for the little one on the go. I definitely recommend them and they are less expensive than in the store.
customer_reviews.author: Stella Tigerwing

customer_reviews.title: So far I really like these. They're very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: So far I really like these. They're very sturdy, and so easy to eat from since you just push the popsicle up. No drips! My 8-year old daughter can make popsicles by herself, and she loves experimenting with putting different liquids in them. I don't know about leakage when they're laid sideways because we've managed to always find room to prop them up vertically in our freezer. But the caps seem to provide a very good seal. It's also not hard to put them on when you have liquid in the molds. I recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle S.

customer_reviews.title: Love these. Perfect for little hands and big ones, too
customer_reviews.text: I love these. I have a 7 month old who has been transitioning to some solid foods for the past month and he still isn't perfect at feeding himself other than when he uses these. I make smoothies with kefir, banana and oats and we have some as a smoothie in the morning and then I freeze the rest for later. The only problem with these is my fault. I need to put less in the molds because he doesn't want to give it back to me until every last drop is gone... And that's too much for his small tummy.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Thought I would love them and my wife and kid would sing praise ...
customer_reviews.text: Thought I would love them and my wife and kid would sing praise to my name.....didnt happen. Tricky getting the frozen goodness to slide up and trying to roll the tapered end to keep it at the top doesn't work like that cheap plastic I am trying to avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Old Mac Man

customer_reviews.title: These are great
customer_reviews.text: These work great. I'm trying to eat healthier and find an alternative to ice cream. I mixed whole milk yogurt with blueberries, walnuts and sometimes shelled pumpkin seeds. A touch of stevia and they turned out great. I measured how much they hold and was able to make 2 cups of the ingredients to fill all 6.
customer_reviews.author: Mollyfish

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THESE! They are so fabulous
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THESE! They are so fabulous. They don't spill and they send you a nice note with tips and tricks for successful use of their product. We got a new Vitamix and have been making smoothies like crazy and now I can throw any leftovers into these and it's a much healthier option for my kiddos and they are SO durable I'll use them again and again and again! The company has been awesome and I love these so much, I just couldn't keep it to myself. There, now I feel better.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie E.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: These are great! Easy to clean & easy to use (even for my pre-schooler). The lids are easy to get on, even when full, and they seem pretty leak proof. I stand them up in a glass until frozen, just in case. The seller was great to follow up to ensure satisfaction and send recipes. My only issue is that I need more! I plan to order a second set.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca M.

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: These work great! I dump excess smoothie mixtures in there and let them freeze on their sides. Note: before using for the first time, soak in vinegar water for about 30 minutes, then wash with dish soap. That will get the rubbery smell out completely.
customer_reviews.author: Amy W

customer_reviews.title: Easy healthy summer  treats
customer_reviews.text: These are great for making healthy summer treats with limited freezer space. No leaks, and once I loosen a pop up by running it under hot water for 30 seconds, my 3-yr-old had no problem eating them with NO MESS!! We had a ton of strawberries after going berry picking at a local farm, but a quick spin in the blender and 8 hours later we had awesome strawberry pops.
customer_reviews.author: anonymouse

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: if popsicle stays in for over a week....taste feels altered in this.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: eco friendly
customer_reviews.text: Love these bough them for my one year old as a fun cool Treat and to make teething popsicles. Great alternative to plastic with the silicone molds & good for kids/adults of any age.
customer_reviews.author: Michael T.

customer_reviews.title: Love the colors
customer_reviews.text: Love the colors. Even if it's winter I had to make a frozen treat to try them. They work well. I will be buying more. On a blog I follow, the lady makes a smoothie and freezes it in silcone ice pep maker molds. Placed in her kids lunch box, works to help keep her kids lunch cold and thaws by lunch time for them to drink. I plan to try this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! My three year old loves them and she doesn't make NEARLY as much of a mess eating popsicles as with standard ones on sticks. All the melted stuff just drains to the bottom of the mold. They are pretty large for a three year old, but are probably about the same volume as a regular popsicle.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Bartee

customer_reviews.title: Fun and so easy pops to go!
customer_reviews.text: We love the silicone ice pop so easy. Pour your juice , put the lid on ut and no chemical after taste. I decided to buy these because I pulled my plastic pop sicle maker and it had an old plastic smell that would not go away. So no more plastic for me,thanks to foodWorks.
customer_reviews.author: Madelou

customer_reviews.title: Multiple Uses
customer_reviews.text: I don't actually use these for ice pops, but plan to in the future. They are the perfect non-plastic container to carry small snacks for my baby and put formula in. They slide into the side of the diaper bag easily. The lid stays on nicely. I haven't had any issues of it popping open. Baby even likes to hold it and teethe on it. Which is ok, it being food-safe silicone.
customer_reviews.author: Mi_Casa

customer_reviews.title: My children absolutely love the ice pop makers
customer_reviews.text: My children absolutely love the ice pop makers. They have made everything from frozen lemonade to rootbeer and yogurt too! These come in bright colors are made from a quality material and wash well. I believe they will last a long time. I highly recommend this product to anyone interested in making their own ice pops.
customer_reviews.author: MRoberts

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I have never bought Gogurts for my kids, due to the dyes and unhealthy ingredients. These molds allow me to send healthy and delicious smoothie pops with my kids to school. They are easy to clean and come in great colors. My kids loved them. The only complaint was that they leaked a little once the smoothie began to melt. I have to figure out a way to prevent that. Other than that, they are great!
customer_reviews.author: DeeB

customer_reviews.title: They flop around and are hard to fill. I tried running warm water over them to loosen the contents and it didnt work very well.
customer_reviews.text: These are okay. They flop around and are hard to fill. I tried running warm water over them to loosen the contents and it didnt work very well. Now I'm stuck with popsicles which are stuck in the holder. One thing that is cool is that you can mix and match the tops which might be fun for kids.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Great for freezing yogurt or homemade shakes during hot weather. Wonderful for teething babies.
customer_reviews.text: These have been so wonderful especially during the summer months. I’m able to freeze yogurt and homemade shakes for our kids to enjoy and cool down. Also wonderful for teething babies.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Padden

customer_reviews.title: These are cool. My only complaints are that they’re a large ...
customer_reviews.text: These are cool. My only complaints are that they’re a large portion and they can be tough for my 3/4yo child’s hands to control. It’s easy to squeeze the pop and shoot out the whole popsicle.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline

customer_reviews.title: Healthy popsicles
customer_reviews.text: I'm trying to eat better more healthy. I bought this Pop maker and use them daily. I fill them with various juices. i.e. orange, grapefruit, orange grapefruit blend, grape juice etc. great late night snack. No smell from the silicon, durable, easy to clean and reuse
customer_reviews.author: Joe L

customer_reviews.title: Don't hestitate! A must have!
customer_reviews.text: These have been great for my little ones but especially my 2.5yo who has soy and dairy allergies, so he misses out on a lot of fun foods/treats. I know exactly what's going into these plus since switching to organic/non-GMO, it helps curb the cost of some more expensive and hard to find items. They're super easy to wash and use, definitely a great addition for our family!
customer_reviews.author: ReneeCush

customer_reviews.title: Excellent - excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent - excellent product. Super easy to clean, tops pop on easy and hold secure. Silicone is thick and sturdy. Originally purchased as a gift for my sister...now I have my own. A great hit with my kiddos. Company also sends emails with simple and fun recipes. I've already made a few!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, very durable. Works great for ice pops. Good tight fitting lid. I bought the FoodWorks Silicone product and also the type with a plastic tray at the same time. These are great. (The other plastic tray version is clumsy, easy to spill, and takes up way too much freezer space.) I will buy another set of these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun and great way to have healthy popsicles
customer_reviews.text: Bought these so I could make popsicles from all the juice I get from wic and my family loves them! Not easy to scrub out, but with hot water they clean easily
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: love these, now just have to keep my boys out of the freezer long enough to let them get hard!
customer_reviews.text: I have only had these a short time, and they are already a family favorite. I bought them for my boys, they chose them as a birthday gift for a friend. My husband got home, stole a bite from my son's smoothie pop and promptly took one out of the freezer for himself. Shortly after I received an email with the most delicious sounding recipes. Love this company and look forward to more! The only suggestion I would make, is to have "baby size" ones for faster freezing.
customer_reviews.author: Charity Miles

customer_reviews.title: Very smelly
customer_reviews.text: These smell terribly and are not easy to clean. I do not recommend them!!
customer_reviews.author: jay

customer_reviews.title: super easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something easy to hold that wouldn't spill when my kids were eating homemade popsicles and these were perfect! They are super easy to fill, don't leak in the freezer and I love that I can toss them in the dishwasher to clean them. I also like that they are soft silicone so I feel like they'll last a lot longer than the hard plastic forms I grew up with. The boys are begging for everything to be in popsicle form now :)
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A MUST for any household with children
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking to make your own ice or yogurt pops definitely get these molds! They are easy to squeeze up - even the 2 year old can use these. Larger than I expected, they are BPA free, so no worries for you or your kids. They say dishwasher safe, although I haven't tried this method yet. They wash by hand easily, just upend to dry. A bonus - The company sends recipes via email to get you started. Super product AND company.
customer_reviews.author: Grandfatherof7

product_meta.title: FoodWorks Silicone Ice Pop Maker Molds/Popsicle Molds, Set of 6
product_meta.description: Make Healthy And Delicious Treats With Our Easy & Fun To Use Silicone Popsicle Molds • Easy to use, kids & adults will love them • Make healthy desserts or an after workout snack • Incredible value - with six molds, there's enough for everyone to enjoy! • Great for birthdays, pool parties or your next BBQ • Reusable, reduces waste & saves money • BPA free & dishwasher safe • No popsicle sticks required Just Fill, Freeze & Enjoy They're so easy to use! Just fill them with juice, purees, fruit, berries or yogurt for a healthy, everyday treat - and for much lower cost than popsicles or freeze pops at the store. For something more decadent, fill with sherbet, ice cream, candy, cocoa...whatever you can dream up! When they're ready, just hold in your hand for a few seconds to warm the outside, then squeeze and enjoy with absolutely no sticking. Can't finish your treat? Just pop the included lid back on and save the rest for later! Get Creative Use the ice pop molds to make frozen margaritas or daiquiris. They're great for partially frozen drinks and slushies since they don't leak. They can even be used to store nuts, candy, fruit, chopped veggies and other miscellaneous items, either at home or on the go. The uses are only limited by your imagination!
feature_bullets: EASY TO USE - Easily make healthy and delicious frozen treats. Use your favorite fruit, juice, smoothie recipe, yogurt and more. With our super tight fitting lids, you’re free to lay them on their sides or stand them lid side down...whatever works best for you! Our unique design makes the molds firmer, easier for kids to hold and easier to clean.

COLORFUL & FUN - Set of 6 fun and vibrant colors. The ice pop molds come in red, green, yellow, orange, purple and blue - each with a matching lid. Both kids and adults will have fun using them. The clever conical shape lets you drink the last drops without the melted mess or drips.

SAVE MONEY - The popsicle makers are flexible, reusable & dishwasher safe. No more wasting money on store bought popsicles or popsicle sticks. You can even save the leftovers by popping on the lid and throwing it back in the freezer for later.

GREAT FOR DRY SNACKS - Perfect for storing dry snacks in lunches or on the go. Put your favorite trail mix, nuts, popcorn, candy or any other dry snacks in them, pop on the lid and you've got the perfect snack container!

PREMIUM QUALITY - Made with 100% BPA free, premium food grade silicone. So you can rest assured they're safe for you and your family. Each ice pop maker is 8 inches long and holds 3.4 fl oz (1/2 cup) and the slim design takes up minimal freezer space.
